bibl.title: Petitioner v. Defendant. Type of document
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court of the Territory of Washington

body.p: In the matter of the application of John Dugan for a writ of Habeas Corpus
Sheriff Fees Returning the within Stipulation to clock 1.00 Milage 2 miles .20 1.20
Territory of Washington } SS County of Spokane
In the District Court of the Fourth Judicial District of said Territory, holding terms at Spokane Falls, in said county and Territory.
In the matter of the } application of John Dugan for writ of Habeas Corpus
To Sheriff of Spokane County; Greeting:

Whereas on the 10th day of June A.D. 1887, one John Dugan was committed by John J. Booge, Esq., a Justice of the Peace in and for said County of Spokane, upon a writ of commitment issued by said Justice of the Peace and directed to said Sheriff committing said John Dugan on failure to give bail for his appearance at the next regular term of the District Court and give this testimony in a certain cause therein pending wherein the Territory of Washington is plaintiff and Mary S. Teller is defendant, and imprisoned by you in pursuance of such writ of commitment, on failure
of said John Dugan to give bail in the sum of $1,000.00

Now, therefore, in the cause of the United States you are commanded that you produce the body of the said John Dugan, by whatever name he is held by upon, before the Hon. George Turner, associate Justice of the Supreme Court of Washington Territory and Judge of said Court, at his chambers in the city of Spokane Falls at ten o'clock a.m. on the 2nd day of July A.D. 1887
Herein fail not, and have you then and there this writ with your return thereon.
Witness the Hon. George Turner Judge of said Court and the seal thereof affixed this 1st day of July A.D. 1887 D.A. Clement Clerk
Territory of Washington } SS. County of Spokane
I James Glispin Sheriff of Spokane County I hereby certify that I have served the within writ to the within Defendant John Dougan, and have him as directed in court"
James Glispin Sheriff of Spokane County W.T By A.J. Duncan Deputy.
